intro: Podosorus, commonly known as the groundsel or common groundsel, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and it thrives in a variety of habitats, including meadows and disturbed soils. Podosorus is often found in open, sunny areas and can spread rapidly through its prolific seed production. Its botanical features make it both ecologically significant and a common weed in agricultural settings.
